intro: Aspicarpa glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziov's aspicarpa, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its fruits are capsule-like and contain small, hard seeds. Aspicarpa glazioviana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
